Package client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
client.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
Class is responsible for connecting with server and correctly maintain the connection It implements Closeable interface to handle Socket closing correctly
Version:
3.0
Author:
Michal Szeler

    • Client

      public Client​(java.lang.String propertiesFileName) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructor for Client class, which initializes all important fields
      Parameters:
      propertiesFileName - Name of file that contains port and server address
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if connection to server cannot be established

  • Method Details

    • encryptMessage

      public java.lang.String encryptMessage​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String publicKey)
      Method that sends to server message and Public Key to encrypt it and returns received encrypted message
      Parameters:
      message - String that contains message to encrypt
      publicKey - String that contains Public Key
      Returns:
      Encrypted text or message that contains explanation for exception thrown on server

    • decryptMessage

      public java.lang.String decryptMessage​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String privateKey)
      Method that sends to server message and Private Key to decrypt it and returns received decrypted message
      Parameters:
      message - String that contains message to decrypt
      privateKey - String that contains Private Key
      Returns:
      Decrypted text or message that contains explanation for exception thrown on server

    • getKeyPair

      public java.lang.String[] getKeyPair() throws java.io.IOException
      Methods that request from server to generate and send a pair of Keys
      Returns:
      Pair of Keys - Private Key at position 0 and Public Key at position 1
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if process wasn't performed correctly

    • getAvailableCommands

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAvailableCommands() throws java.io.IOException
      Methods returns list of available commands on server
      Returns:
      List of available methods
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if process wasn't performed correctly

      public void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Method ensures that Socket is correctly closed
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      Throws:
